title: MAG 034 - Anatomy Class - Transcript Re-formatted-converted
text:
could be in on it, of course, but Tim seems to believe her. 
There’s also the matter of the teeth. I stand by my assessment that there is no 
evidence they were placed there by supernatural means, but it does seem an 
awfully long way to go for a bad joke. In the end we did send them off to a 
dental specialist, but they weren’t able to tell us much beyond the fact that 
they all seemed like healthy adult teeth, and most of them appeared to come 
from different people. 
There’s not much more we can do to follow this up, without dedicating 
additional time we can’t afford. The only other lead was Sasha’s discovery that, 
early last year, Dr. Rashid Sadana took his own life. There’s no direct 

The Magnus Archives – MAG034 – Anatomy Class 
16 
 
connection, except that he taught the Anatomy, Physiology and Pathology for 
Complementary Therapies course at St Mary’s University, and the only note 
found near the body simply read “Not To Be Used For Teaching”. 
End recording. 
 
JONATHAN SIMS 
(Read a loud from the archived witness statement of Nathan Watts) 
[Main Body of Statement] 
JONATHAN SIMS 
Statement ends. 
[Post statement] 
Recording Ends. 
[The Magnus Archives Theme - Outro]
